p.s: First of all I have to say that the book The Hate U Give aswellas well as the movie is something I really enjoyed watching/reading.
You can see that the booksbook is also from a black womenwoman because their perspective is a little bit different than shown in the media and I really like that.
This movie gave me a new perspective of life and a specially of people who get discriminated everyday.
I think it's so sad to see what is happening in this world and that the media who should inform triestry to hide most of the bad things.
For teenagers it's already hard because you start a new chapter in your life but if you have to go through the same thing as Starr it's even harder.
I think no kid or teenager should looselose a friend this early especially because of a police officer.
In my opinion you should be trusting the police and not be afraid of them.
The film itself didn't change my life that much but it made me overthink some stuff.
This helps me a lot to empathize with more people.
I'm not saying I know exactly how they feel but this film helps me understand them more especially their feelings.
Everyone has a story to tell and they should tell everyone.
This film also made me question if there are people around me who act like Hailey without them or me knowing.
I recommend watching this film if you haven't already because this shows you (especially when you are white) a whole new perspective of life.
